latest news.eng_title: Gasoline Prices in France See Slight Increase, Gasoline Prices Continue to Fall
latest news.summary: Gasoline prices in France have seen a slight increase, while gasoline prices continue to fall for the seventh consecutive week. The average price of gasoline was 1.6117 euros per liter, up 0.2 cents from the previous week, while the average price of gasoline was 1.7077 euros per liter, down 1 cent from the previous week. This is the first increase in gasoline prices in 6 weeks, according to the weekly report published by the Ministry of Ecological Transition. The price of gasoline has not been this low since December 2022, when it benefited from a 10-cent government discount and a 10-cent discount from Totalenergies, resulting in a total discount of 20 cents. Meanwhile, global oil prices remain relatively low due to poor economic growth forecasts, with the Brent North Sea crude oil price falling 4.2 dollars to 76.7 dollars per barrel last week.
latest news.title: Prix des carburants: légère remontée du gazole, l'essence encore en baisse

latest news.eng_title: AAA releases weekly gas prices as fall closes in on NNY
latest news.summary: AAA of Western and Central New York released its weekly gas prices, showing a drop in prices across the region. In Watertown, the average price of gas decreased by 7 cents to $3.39, the steepest decline in the region. The national average price for a gallon of gasoline is $3.27, down 6 cents from last week. The state average is $3.42, down 5 cents from last Monday. The Energy Information Administration (EIA) reports that gas demand fell last week while domestic supply rose slightly, contributing to the decline in prices. According to AAA, falling gasoline demand and oil costs will likely keep pump prices sliding down as autumn approaches.
latest news.title: AAA releases weekly gas prices as fall closes in on NNY

latest news.eng_title: For the sixth straight week, Peoria area drivers see prices drop at the pump
latest news.summary: For the sixth consecutive week, gas prices in the Peoria area have decreased, with an average price of $3.57 a gallon, according to GasBuddy's survey of 148 stations. This is 16.9 cents lower than a month ago and 24.4 cents a gallon less than a year ago. Patrick De Haan, head of petroleum analysis at GasBuddy, stated, 'GasBuddy now counts 11 states and over 45,000 stations with gas prices below $3 per gallon.' He expects gas prices to continue dropping as Americans drive less in the fall, with oil prices falling below $70 per barrel, their lowest since 2021. De Haan predicts the national average could fall below $3 per gallon as early as October, which would be the first time since 2021.
latest news.title: For the sixth straight week, Peoria area drivers see prices drop at the pump

latest news.eng_title: Gas prices: More decreases at the pumps to start the work week - Washington Examiner
latest news.summary: Gas prices have continued to fall across the country, with 11 states now having an average price below $3 per gallon. The national average price for a gallon of regular gas on Monday was $3.296, a decrease from $3.273 on Sunday and $3.331 a week ago. Vice President Kamala Harris, the Democratic presidential nominee, will need to address the country's high gas prices and energy costs in the 2024 presidential election. Gas prices vary significantly among states, with the lowest price in Mississippi at $2.79 per gallon and the highest in Washington, D.C. at $3.526 per gallon. California's gas prices are also soaring, with a gallon of regular gas costing $4.712 on Monday.
latest news.title: Gas prices: More decreases at the pumps to start the work week - Washington Examiner

latest news.eng_title: Will the Price of Gasoline Increase Due to the Removal of Fiscal Stimulus?

Organization: Secretariat of Finance and Public Credit

latest news.summary: The price of gasoline in Mexico may increase due to the removal of fiscal stimulus by the Secretariat of Finance and Public Credit (SHCP). According to the Diario Oficial de la Federación (DOF), the SHCP announced that there will be no assistance for gasoline from September 7 to 13. The fiscal stimulus was previously given to gasoline from September 1 to 7, but this time it was not given to any type of fuel. As a result, the price of gasoline may vary from September 7 to 13, except for Premium gasoline, which has not received support since October 2023. Diesel also does not receive fiscal stimulus since the second half of July, when it received 5.5% support. The price of gasolina Magna will be 6.17 pesos per liter, down from 3.3% support last week. The prices will be as follows: 'The prices will be as follows: 6.17 pesos per liter for gasolina Magna, 6.23 pesos per liter for gasolina Regular, and 6.42 pesos per liter for gasolina Premium.' said the article. The fiscal stimulus percentages for gasoline will be in effect from September 7 to 13, 2024.
latest news.title: ¿Aumentará el precio de la gasolina por el retiro del estímulo fiscal? Lo que debes saber

latest news.eng_title: Falling gas prices are yet another blow to the Trump campaign
latest news.summary: Former President Donald Trump has been using high gas prices to attack Vice President Kamala Harris, claiming they have 'soared' to $8 a gallon. However, fact-checkers have dismissed this as false. While gas prices have risen in recent years, reaching a high of $4.93 a gallon in mid-2022, they have been declining steadily for the last five months, according to the American Automobile Association. As of now, 10 states have gasoline averages below $3 a gallon, and the national average price for a gallon of gas is $3.30, a 6-cent decline from the previous week. Andrew Gross, a spokesperson for AAA, said that this trend is likely to continue due to low gas demand and the current cost of oil at about $70 per barrel.
latest news.title: Falling gas prices are yet another blow to the Trump campaign

news knowledge.eng_title: Gas prices: National average cost falls to under $3.30 per gallon - Washington Examiner
news knowledge.summary: The national average gas price has fallen to under $3.30 per gallon, a decrease of over five cents from last week's price of $3.35 per gallon and 16 cents from last month's price of $3.462 per gallon. Ten states now have average gas prices below $3 per gallon, with Kansas on the verge of joining them. Gas prices remain a pressing issue ahead of the 2024 presidential election, with Vice President Kamala Harris, the Democratic nominee, needing to address how she will tackle high gas prices and energy costs. While prices have decreased in recent weeks, they remain higher than when former President Donald Trump was in office. Gas prices vary significantly among states, with Mississippi having the lowest price at $2.824 per gallon and California having the highest price at $4.666 per gallon.
news knowledge.title: Gas prices: National average cost falls to under $3.30 per gallon - Washington Examiner

news knowledge.eng_title: Gas prices: National average cost falls to under $3.30 per gallon
news knowledge.summary: The national average gas price has fallen to $3.296 per gallon, according to AAA, the lowest average price since this past winter. This is a decrease of over five cents per gallon from last week's price of $3.35 and over 16 cents from last month's price of $3.462. Ten states now have an average gas price below $3 per gallon, with Kansas on the verge of becoming the 11th state. Gas prices remain a significant issue heading into the 2024 presidential election, with Vice President Kamala Harris, the Democratic nominee, needing to address the country's high gas prices and energy costs. While prices have decreased in recent weeks and months, they remain higher than when former President Donald Trump was in office. Gas prices vary significantly among states, with California now having the most expensive gas in the nation at $4.666 per gallon.
news knowledge.title: Gas prices: National average cost falls to under $3.30 per gallon

news knowledge.eng_title: Could gas prices fall to $3 per gallon by the end of 2024?
news knowledge.summary: The national average price of gasoline has fallen by $0.50 per gallon compared to last year, with some states along the Gulf of Mexico already seeing prices below $3 per gallon. According to Andy Lippo of Lipo Oil Associates, there is a 'good possibility' that the national average retail price of gasoline could hit $3 per gallon by the end of the year. This is due in part to a downtrend in oil prices, with gasoline futures at three-year lows and oil prices expected to continue to fall if OPEC Plus adds more supply in October.
news knowledge.title: Could gas prices fall to $3 per gallon by the end of 2024?

news knowledge.eng_title: Gas prices could drop to $3 by year end, says analyst
news knowledge.summary: Gasoline prices have been declining due to lower oil prices and approaching three-year lows in gasoline futures. The national average price on Wednesday was $3.32 per gallon, $0.15 lower than a month ago and $0.49 less than last year. Andy Lipow, president of Lipow Oil Associates, predicts that the national average could fall to $3 per gallon by the end of the year, as most of the country switches to a less expensive winter grade gasoline. Lipow notes that the low prices may force OPEC+ to rethink its policy and stick with existing production levels. Currently, oil prices have collapsed 4% amid concerns over China's economy and additional supply expected from OPEC+ this fall.
news knowledge.title: Gas prices could drop to $3 by year end, says analyst

news knowledge.eng_title: Gas prices could drop to $3 by year-end, analyst says
news knowledge.summary: Gasoline prices have been declining due to falling oil prices and lower demand. The national average price on Wednesday was $3.32 per gallon, $0.15 lower than a month ago and $0.49 less than last year. Analyst Andy Lipow predicts that the national average could drop to $3 per gallon by the end of the year, citing the end of the summer driving season and a quiet hurricane season. Lipow also notes that oil prices may force OPEC+ to rethink its production policy, potentially sticking with existing levels. As of Wednesday, nine states had average retail prices below $3 per gallon, with half the country expected to reach those levels by the end of September.
news knowledge.title: Gas prices could drop to $3 by year-end, analyst says

news knowledge.eng_title: Here's How Gas Prices Look Ahead of This Labor Day Weekend
news knowledge.summary: The national average price for a gallon of gasoline is $3.35 as of August 27, trending below 2023 and 2022 levels for this time of year. AAA expects a 9% increase in Labor Day weekend travel over 2023, but overall demand for fuel is relatively soft due to pandemic-era changes in weekday travel. Gas prices are still falling in many parts of the country, with the current average resting about half a dollar below that of the two previous years. According to AAA spokesperson Andrew Gross, 'The clouds of war overseas are less dark at the moment, and the Atlantic is quiet now too, which is taking pressure off of oil prices.' Despite summer travel holidays having seen some high water marks, commutes and daily driving trends are now different enough to be noticeable year round.
news knowledge.title: Here's How Gas Prices Look Ahead of This Labor Day Weekend

news knowledge.eng_title: Gasoline prices 'have seen their summer peak': Analyst
news knowledge.summary: According to oil analyst Andy Lipow, gasoline prices have already seen their summer peak and are expected to decline as we get into October. The national average price of a gallon of gas is currently at $3.46, down from $3.51 a month ago and $0.37 lower than a year ago. Lipow attributes this to adequate gasoline inventories and a decrease in demand. However, he notes that an oil supply disruption due to conflict in the Middle East could send prices higher. Meanwhile, oil prices have decreased by 10% since the beginning of July, with West Texas Intermediate (WTI) prices hovering above $75 per barrel and Brent prices trading just above $78 per barrel. Analysts at Capital Economics predict that Brent prices will rise back to $80 per barrel by the end of the year.
news knowledge.title: Gasoline prices 'have seen their summer peak': Analyst

news knowledge.summary: The national average price of gasoline is $3.47 per gallon, a 0.7 cent increase from last week. In New York State, prices are down 2.1 cents, averaging $3.57 per gallon. According to GasBuddy data, the national average is 0.8 cents lower than a month ago and 25.2 cents lower than a year ago. Patrick De Haan, head of petroleum analysis at GasBuddy, said, 'We continue to see a mixed bag when it comes to gas prices across the country.' He also noted that the summer winding down and disappointing gasoline demand could lead to a further decline in national average prices. US retail gasoline demand rose 0.6 percent during the week ending Saturday, July 27. The most common price per gallon encountered by motorists remains unchanged at $3.39.
news knowledge.title: Gas prices rise again

news knowledge.eng_title: Gas Prices Tick Higher As Oil Prices Fail To Gain Momentum
news knowledge.summary: U.S. gasoline prices have increased slightly, with the national average price of gasoline averaging 5.2 cents higher than a month ago but 5.8 cents per gallon lower than a year ago. The national average price of diesel climbed 2.3 cents in the last week to $3.83 per gallon but remained unchanged from a year ago. Patrick De Haan, head of petroleum analysis at GasBuddy, predicts that prices will continue to see small fluctuations as news of any hurricane-fueled refinery disruptions comes in. Oil prices have been facing downward pressure due to growing concerns about demand in top importer China, offsetting support from strong demand elsewhere, OPEC+ supply restraint, and geopolitical tensions in the Middle East.
news knowledge.title: Gas Prices Tick Higher As Oil Prices Fail To Gain Momentum
